مقابلة مع أسعد أبو هواش

oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Arab tribes; Food; Income; Princes; Sheep; Wives; Work; Castles; Cats; Fathers; Kingdoms; Kings; Maiden; Socio-economic conditions; Queens; Rocks; Roosters; Storytelling; Theft; Traditional medical procedures; Wedding celebration; Wives; Castles; Caves; Childbirth; Children; Clothing and dresses; Fiction; Fishermen; Gold; Guards; Heir; Dwellings; Husbands; Jinn; Kingdoms; Kings; Marriage; Socio-economic conditions; Queens; Ugliness; Victory; Wars; Wives; Camels; Chickens; Dance; Death; Disputes; Donkeys; Drought; Farm animals; Farmers; Forests; Hyenas; Jackals; Land; Lions; Means of transportation; Revenge; Singing; Water resources; Water wells
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on April 1, 1997 with Asʻad Abū Hawwāsh, male, born in 1927 in Haifa, Palestine and resides in al-Baṣṣ Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع أسعد أبو هواش في 1 نيسان ابريل عام 1997، ذكر، ولد عام 1927 في حيفا، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم البص للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
